oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Elmington Park Litter Patrol, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, Vol. 3 p67-69
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of two boys acting as the Elmington Park Litter Patrol. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, July 1958. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
